about.description:
libiio is used to interface to the Linux Industrial Input/Output (IIO) Subsystem.
The Linux IIO subsystem is intended to provide support for devices that in some
sense are analog to digital or digital to analog converters (ADCs, DACs). This
includes, but is not limited to ADCs, Accelerometers, Gyros, IMUs, Capacitance to
Digital Converters (CDCs), Pressure Sensors, Color, Light and Proximity Sensors,
Temperature Sensors, Magnetometers, DACs, DDS (Direct Digital Synthesis), PLLs
(Phase Locked Loops), Variable/Programmable Gain Amplifiers (VGA, PGA), and RF
transceivers. You can use libiio natively on an embedded Linux target (local mode),
or use libiio to communicate remotely to that same target from a host Linux,
Windows or MAC over USB or Ethernet or Serial.
about.summary: Library for interfacing with Linux IIO devices

name: libiio-c
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.24.0
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: libiio-c
  version: '0.24'
source:
  sha256: a2b5d848531ea64fd9f95327dfd5a588bd227d9577281ec375e822702c6a52d5
  url: https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/libiio/archive/v0.24.tar.gz
build:
  number: 1
  run_exports:
    - libiio-c >=0.24,<1.0a0
  string: hf23a713_1
requirements:
  build:
    - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 2_gnu
    - _sysroot_linux-aarch64_curr_repodata_hack 4 h57d6b7b_13
    - binutils_impl_linux-64 2.40 hf600244_0
    - binutils_impl_linux-aarch64 2.39 h57c828d_1
    - binutils_linux-aarch64 2.39 h9a81858_13
    - bzip2 1.0.8 h7f98852_4
    - c-ares 1.19.0 hd590300_0
    - ca-certificates 2023.5.7 hbcca054_0
    - cmake 3.26.3 h077f3f9_0
    - expat 2.5.0 hcb278e6_1
    - gcc_impl_linux-64 12.2.0 hcc96c02_19
    - gcc_impl_linux-aarch64 12.2.0 h74c8edf_19
    - gcc_linux-aarch64 12.2.0 hc1bb72a_13
    - kernel-headers_linux-64 2.6.32 he073ed8_15
    - kernel-headers_linux-aarch64 4.18.0 h5b4a56d_13
    - keyutils 1.6.1 h166bdaf_0
    - krb5 1.20.1 h81ceb04_0
    - ld_impl_linux-64 2.40 h41732ed_0
    - ld_impl_linux-aarch64 2.39 hc438fd5_1
    - libcurl 8.1.0 h409715c_0
    - libedit 3.1.20191231 he28a2e2_2
    - libev 4.33 h516909a_1
    - libexpat 2.5.0 hcb278e6_1
    - libgcc-devel_linux-64 12.2.0 h3b97bd3_19
    - libgcc-devel_linux-aarch64 12.2.0 hb41d4e8_19
    - libgcc-ng 12.2.0 h65d4601_19
    - libgomp 12.2.0 h65d4601_19
    - libnghttp2 1.52.0 h61bc06f_0
    - libsanitizer 12.2.0 h46fd767_19
    - libssh2 1.10.0 hf14f497_3
    - libstdcxx-ng 12.2.0 h46fd767_19
    - libuv 1.44.2 h166bdaf_0
    - libzlib 1.2.13 h166bdaf_4
    - make 4.3 hd18ef5c_1
    - ncurses 6.3 h27087fc_1
    - openssl 3.1.0 hd590300_3
    - pkg-config 0.29.2 h36c2ea0_1008
    - rhash 1.4.3 h166bdaf_0
    - sysroot_linux-64 2.12 he073ed8_15
    - sysroot_linux-aarch64 2.17 h5b4a56d_13
    - xz 5.2.6 h166bdaf_0
    - zlib 1.2.13 h166bdaf_4
    - zstd 1.5.2 h3eb15da_6
  host:
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 2_gnu
    - attr 2.5.1 h4e544f5_1
    - bison 3.8.2 h2f0025b_0
    - flex 2.6.4 h884eca8_1004
    - icu 72.1 hcf00150_0
    - libaio 0.3.113 h4e544f5_0
    - libcap 2.67 h8246067_0
    - libgcc-ng 12.2.0 h607ecd0_19
    - libgomp 12.2.0 h607ecd0_19
    - libiconv 1.17 h9cdd2b7_0
    - libstdcxx-ng 12.2.0 hc13a102_19
    - libudev1 253 hb4cce97_1
    - libusb 1.0.26 hb041f25_100
    - libxml2 2.11.3 h164fba4_2
    - libzlib 1.2.13 h4e544f5_4
    - m4 1.4.18 h516909a_1001
    - xz 5.2.6 h9cdd2b7_0
    - zstd 1.5.2 h44f6412_6
  run:
    - libaio >=0.3.113,<0.4.0a0
    - libgcc-ng >=12
    - libusb >=1.0.26,<2.0a0
    - libxml2 >=2.11.3,<2.12.0a0
    - zstd >=1.5.2,<1.6.0a0
test:
  commands:
    - iio_attr --help
    - iio_genxml --help
    - iio_info --help
    - iio_readdev --help
    - iio_reg --help
    - iio_writedev --help
    - iio_adi_xflow_check --help
    - iiod --help
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/iio.h
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libiio${SHLIB_EXT}
about:
  description: 'libiio is used to interface to the Linux Industrial Input/Output (IIO)
    Subsystem.

    The Linux IIO subsystem is intended to provide support for devices that in some

    sense are analog to digital or digital to analog converters (ADCs, DACs). This

    includes, but is not limited to ADCs, Accelerometers, Gyros, IMUs, Capacitance
    to

    Digital Converters (CDCs), Pressure Sensors, Color, Light and Proximity Sensors,

    Temperature Sensors, Magnetometers, DACs, DDS (Direct Digital Synthesis), PLLs

    (Phase Locked Loops), Variable/Programmable Gain Amplifiers (VGA, PGA), and RF

    transceivers. You can use libiio natively on an embedded Linux target (local mode),

    or use libiio to communicate remotely to that same target from a host Linux,

    Windows or MAC over USB or Ethernet or Serial.

    '
  dev_url: https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/libiio
  doc_url: https://analogdevicesinc.github.io/libiio/
  home: https://github.com/analogdevicesinc/libiio
  license: LGPL-2.1-or-later AND GPL-3.0-or-later
  license_family: LGPL
  license_file:
    - COPYING.txt
    - COPYING_GPL.txt
  summary: Library for interfacing with Linux IIO devices
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  feedstock-name: libiio
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - ryanvolz

about.description:
libiio is used to interface to the Linux Industrial Input/Output (IIO) Subsystem.
The Linux IIO subsystem is intended to provide support for devices that in some
